channel.title: Best Alienware M11x for PCSX2
channel.description:
Which Alienware M11x (other than the i7 series) is best for running PCSX2? I know that the M11x can run WoW maxed out and some source games with high settings. But which is best for PCSX2? I had 2 in mind:
1. Alienware M11x Power for High Definition gaming and ultra portability in a single laptop is no longer a fantasy! Now with Intel® Core™2 Duo Processor. Cost: $1,299.
or:
2. Alienware M11x Ultra mobile gaming laptop with Intel® Core™ i5 processor & bigger storage capacity for better performance! Cost: $1,499.30.
Which one? (Also, does 2. have dual core or is it single?)

item.title: Best Alienware M11x for PCSX2
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Lil Master:

well, it is actually better to buy a ps2, but i dont want it, because im definitely going 2 buy an alienware laptop, so i thought id get the one that runs pcsx2 better. if ps3 was able to run ps1-ps2 games, there wouldnt be this prob anyways >

But anyways, if the m11x i5 cpu is dual core, then im sure that one would be better (for the pcsx anyways). I love ps2, makes me feel nostalgic.

Well, if all you really care about is running a ps2 emu then either system should work. I don’t know much about pcsx2 or how much power it takes but it’s definitely gonna be less than Crysis. If money is at all important in your decision, either buy the cheaper alienware or buy from another company that will give you a better deal. Like others said asus is pretty good.

Read full topic

item.description:
Like ASUS. Very well priced, durable, great cooling, available in many stores (even Best Buy), etc. etc.

item.title: Best Alienware M11x for PCSX2
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
Alienware is insanely overpriced for what you get, like Apple.

Don’t get Alienware. Buy from some other more-trusted company and get far MORE power for far LESS money, and better reliability and support.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Alienware M11x for PCSX2
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
WoW maxed out and some source games high settings??? That’s nothing. You can probably play Crysis on medium-high settings on those two set ups. If all you want to do is run a ps2 emulator I highly doubt you’d need something as expensive as an alienware laptop. And if you do want to get an alienware laptop why play old ps2 games? Do what the machine is made for and play some newer games made for pc.

Crysis on an M11x

Read full topic

item.description:
Uh no, pretty much every CPU Intel makes these days are either dual, quad or hexacore (physically).
